Our bed wasnt changed on the second day even though it was clearly dirty we had spilt curry sauce on it and had to sleep in it on the second night, not very nice! the bathroom wasnt very clean hair in the sink, stained sink and the shower took ages to heat up! The heating didnt work in the room which i think they knew about we had a heater in there already but it wasnt the same! On the last morning housekeeping knocked on the door and woke me up, luckily didnt wake my partner but since it was the day we were leaving this shouldnt have happened it was about 8.30 and i couldnt get back to sleep. The staff in the resturant seemed new and didnt really know what they were doing, which was annoying! I was so excited for this trip and it was all ruined, this list could go on....

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Premier Inn”
Reviews.Author: myopinionWales
Reviews.Content: I generally find Premier Inns to be good value with very competent service. This hotel was a disappointment. It had fairly recently been taken over by Premier Inn and needs a lot of investment. We took two rooms. One on the second floor was nicely refurbished, but the second room on one of the higher floors was draughty, some of the bathroom fittings were damaged, and it was cramped. The view however was great, We reported several issues to staff who seemed indiferrent, which is unusual for a Premier Inn. Breakfast was chaotic. Not enough staff or food laid out or space. Again, this is unusual for a Prmeier Inn. By the way, I have noticed in my last few stays at a Premier Inn that the buffet breakfast (one of their pluses) doesnt represent such good value - price has gone up, selection has gone down. On the plus side, the hotel was very well placed for the M4 and west London (we were in London for a football match at QPR, museum visit, and a theatre show) and had good parking. The trip was part of a Christmas present , and we went for a family meal at an Indian Restaurant opposite the hotel, called Indian Zing. This must be the best Indian meal I have ever had and would definitely recommend it. I would stay again, but in the hope that the hotel had improved to meet my usual expectations of a Premier Inn - and for a return visit to Indian Zing!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: clairenadine
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night for a London sightseeing tour with our 8 year old son and my partner. Parking our car for £15 for 24 hrs was a great price in a secure location, although I would like to have booked my parking space prior to our arrival as there are only 20 spaces but as it happens we got a space no problem. We spent our day in London and arrived back at the hotel at approx 7 pm. Our room was very fresh and clean as was the bathroom, no noise from the traffic or other guests, our room was out the back so this may have helped (room 206). We had our evening meal in the small but cosy restaurant which was not a great success as the chef was new and not really up to speed. On our departure the reception team did ask if there were any problems which we did say with regards to the evening meal and the problems we encountered, they immediately rectified the problem with sincere apologies and a refund on the food. Ash and Maryan were on the reception on day of departure and were brilliant as were the two ladies the previous evening who were running reception, bar, restaurant and the cooking and all with great big smiles. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend this Premier Inn. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - ideal for a city break! Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: camuk33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this excellent hotel last weekend which proved to be a fantastic spot for a short break in London. There was a minor, initial problem at check in (the room card wouldn't work - but that was quickly rectified by the helpful staff on Reception). The hotel is located close to Hammersmith Station (about a 10 min walk - you can't miss the imposing hotel - which has about 12 floors!) and Ravenscourt Station (around a 3 min walk), so it was very easy to get to. The room was spotlessly clean, well maintained and the bed was very comfortable and provided us with two nights' good sleep! The hotel staff were faultless - all of them were cheerful and made the point of saying "good morning" at breakfast, which added to the general friendliness of this hotel. Breakfast was well organised, and we opted for the continental option - and food was plentiful, with loads of fresh fruit, yogurts, croissants, cereal etc on offer. It as handy being able to go from breakfast anytime from 7.30am to 11.00am. Check out time was generous too, being at 12pm. I'd highly recommend this hotel for a short break in the city - Hammersmith is a great base, if you want somewhere a bit quieter to go in the evening after the hustle and bustle of Central London! Plus this hotel was far cheaper than any other equivalent, when we booked - so provided excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: marty1962_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Premier Inn for two days over christmas to meet our family and i have to say that i was very pleasantly surprised. the staff were the friendliest i have ever met, it seemed like they had an intensive customer service course. Anlissa at the desk on the 24th was just incredible; she was very polite and very friendly. everyone at the hotel made me feel valuable and they all remembered my name. I will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, reasonably priced, clean, close to the Tube - ideal”
Reviews.Author: Triggerhart
Reviews.Content: Although an area I know well, Hammersmith was not my first choice of area to stay in for my business trip to London. However, many of the hotels closer to town were either fully booked or quoting laughable rates and so I ended up here by default. I'm so glad I did because I felt like a genuinely valued and welcome guest here From check in quite late last night to leaving this morning I couldn't fault this hotel. My room was immaculately clean and very comfortable. After a lovely night's sleep I enjoyed a hot shower with decent water pressure before heading down for breakfast. Hotel dining rooms first thing in the morning can be soulless and depressing but my spirits lifted immediately upon being greeted with a big smile and welcomed to a table. Every single member of staff acknowledged me and wished me a good morning. The continental breakfast option was good with fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries, toast, juice and hot drinks. I was more than ready to face the day ahead by the time I had finished. While check out was efficient and quick the member of staff who dealt with me took the time to check I had enjoyed my stay and was anxious to find out if there was anything I needed before I was on my way into town. And it didn't smack of that going through the motions tone I encounter in so many other hotels. This was a refreshing change. Ravenscourt Park Tube station is a couple of minutes walk away and I was in the office, relaxed, refreshed and raring to go by 8.30am. How different from my usual business stay-overs where I am frequently tired, frazzled and ready for home before the day has even begun. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: baba49
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at this hotel numerous of times and I enjoyed every stay. Perfect location,central,but out of the rush. Clean rooms and friendly,helpful staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “a good choice”
Reviews.Author: carolpaul14
Reviews.Content: Staff great,close to the underground.25 to 30 minutes from the shows etc in Leicester square. I asked for a room on the 2nd floor and it was very good.(following a tip). Good price and no problems.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: paddywak
Reviews.Content: My frends and I had a short break in London, we stayed in the Hammersmith Premier inn for three nights,I honestly cannot see what other reviewers are gurning about,you get excellent service and value in this hotel,of course not everything suits everyone, but it is very different here, the staff are most friendly and always with a smile,they are a credit to the company,nothing is to much trouble for them,the hotel has great security with key cards opening the lift doors and room doors, There is only two points that I would like to mention, )1) the charge for full as much as you can eat breakfast is £7.75, where as if you walk up towards Hammersmith Station you can get a full English breakfast for £5.50,also the sink tap and shelf are too short,you bump your head on the shelf when washing your face..All in all very pleased with the hotel and would definatley stay there again..And thank you to all the staff..P. Molloy ,P.Lowry ,R.Mc Grogan...

Reviews.Title: “Customer service second to none”
Reviews.Author: weezworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Premier Inn for 1 night. We travel a lot and have stayed in some high end hotels around the world. This hotel was ideally placed for us to get to the Hammersmith Apollo (1 tube stop away). The hotel was exceptionally clean and the rooms, whilst basic but perfectly adequate. The check in process was quick and efficient. Breakfast was incredibly good value for money and one of the best we have had in a hotel in this country. The views from our room (1201) were fantastic but what stood out most of all was the amazing customer service. I have never been so impressed-all staff were very friendly, attentive and genuinely concerned that guests had everything they needed. I would like to compliment the staff team on this. For value for money and great service this was a great choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Their Hypnose bed didn't g'tee me a good night sleep just bites from bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Wudgieboon
Reviews.Content: I was attending a course over a 4 week period requiring me to stay at the Premier Inn for between 2-3 nights per week. I did not have a say in where I got to stay and having travelled the world and stayed primarily in genuine premier hotel groups, I was not looking forward to my stay at a budget hotel. However, having been checked in to a 2nd floor room all of which are refurbished I was pleasantly surprised at the standard of the room. However, the claim of a good night sleep on the hypnose mattress is not so as I found the beds in each of the rooms I stayed in to be extremely uncomfortable and awoke each morning with a stiff back and aching ribs!!! Having arrived at the hotel in week 3 and been greeted by Jane who I will say is an extremely professional and pleasant member of the team, was allocated room 211 which I had stayed in during the previous week and was very happy to be staying there again. Regretabley, during the two nights of my stay I was horribley bitten over 35 times on my arms and legs and it was only on the morning of my departure that the Operations Manager admitted there was a current infestation problem in the hotel which was being treated by a company called Ecolab. So if you are about to check in and see their vans parked outside, carry on walking and find another hotel elsewhere!!! A colleague had overheard a conversation that several rooms were being treated on another floor at the time!!! I had to return to the hotal the following Tuesday for another 2 night stay and was extremely worried as having spoken to Environmental Health, I was advised bedbugs are extremely difficult to get rid of once they are established as they can hibernate anywhere in a room for months at a time, and are easily transferred between rooms through air conditioning ducts, by the cleaners as the move from room to room and so on!!! I was assured by the Operations Manager that I would be well looked after with a good room (I was not, as I was allocated a standard room after being in a family sized room for the previous 2 weeks and had to complain before being moved!) Other issues with the Operations Manager made me realise that the management didn't care for their customers despite stating they did have a bedbug infestation problem and I had been a victim! So my advice to anyone thinking about going to a Premier Inn and this one in particular is, you will be paying them a lot of money (no where near the so called £29!!!) for a night's sleep in a bed that will at least be pretty uncomfortable but could also include some nasty critters leaving you with bites that will itch for at least 5 days which antihistamines do not relieve, AND also LOOK extremely unsightly. THAT IS A RISK I WONT BE TAKING AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Service Good - Hotel Fine”
Reviews.Author: Inverclyde
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel was fine; Room was fine; Breakfast was fine. Not as good as other Premier Inns I have stayed in but I as I said the hotel was fine. A bit far out from the city but hotel is just across from Ravenscourt Tube Station.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrightonAndy
Reviews.Content: My company arranged for me to stay at the Premier Inn Hammersmith for one night in early May. I checked in relatively late and it's fair to say I was simply using the hotel as a place to get a decent nights sleep and no more than that. It fitted the bill fine. The hotel is in a converted office block and the corridors still have a slightly institutional feel, it's certainly not going to win awards for design, but then Premier Inn is hardly a design led chain!. The room was one of the smaller ones which was OK as a solo traveller, however it was a shame there wasn't a full size bath for me to stretch out and enjoy a soak in. I was on a high floor, twelfth I think, so the views were lovely. I got a good nights sleep however colleagues were disturbed throughout the night by students staying at the hotel (four to a room apparently so hardly surprising!). My colleagues did call down to reception, but naturally as soon as the students were asked to be quiet they did so for all of five minutes before starting up again. Breakfast was of a good standard and the breakfast team were all really friendly. The cost for one night was in excess of £100 which in honesty I thought was a bit steep and I probably would have searched for another hotel offering greater value for money had I been personally responsible for making the booking. Overall the hotel felt squarely budget. I'd compare the hotel room to a decent en-suite room in a halls of residence, though I understand there are some new rooms on the second floor where meeting rooms have been converted, apparently they have the 'new' Premier Inn look, but they don't get the views...

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: prof_crunch
Reviews.Content: There was a bit of a scrum at check-in when we arrived but, to be fair, we secured our room with a minimum of fuss. We were given a well-proportioned corner room on the first floor, which had room enough for a desk along with hanging space, flatscreen telly and the usual tea-making facilities. The bathroom was also far less poky than you might expect from such budget accommodation (we paid £59 for one night, not including breakfast). Certainly everything felt basic and the maintenance was slightly lacklustre - the shaving light didn't work, for instance, and the shelf in the bathroom felt as if it might detach itself from the wall at any moment. And curiously, the shower - which you couldn't adjust - had been plumbed in so that it couldn't comfortably be used by anyone over the height of around 5ft 2in. But, for the price, these are minor grievances and for what we wanted - somewhere inexpensive that was walking distance to the Hammersmith Apollo - it was perfectly acceptable. For a one-night stopover, I'd be happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay During Trying Time”
Reviews.Author: errabunda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Premier Inn London Hammersmith because it is close to our son and his family. Our room was small, and our son said it was smaller than other rooms other family members have stayed in, BUT I mentioned in my reservation request that my husband has limited ability to use stairs, and this room was on the first floor next to a staircase. Having had to help him out of a seventh-floor room in a burning Canadian hotel at a time when he had a bit more mobility, I really appreciated the concern for our safety. The room was very clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the staff was wonderful. We had to extend our stay a bit because of the Icelandic volcano and the resulting closure of UK airspace, and the staff worked hard to make sure all the stranded passengers we well cared-for. This hotel is located in a real residential neighborhood, across from a park, and there are many child-friendly restaurants and cafes nearby. This is the usual hotel for international guests visiting my son and his wife and child, and so far everyone has felt they got good value for their money.

Reviews.Title: “be careful how you book”
Reviews.Author: tilly321
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed in this hotel yet (booked for 13.04.10) and probably won't be able to now. I booked one overnight stay on the net and later realised I'd got my son's school holidays wrong. The call centre simply said no refunds, no ammendments. I completely accept I'm at fault I would just like a little human good will. I understand why they have this policy- late cancellations must be problematic and the offer price reflects the risk you take- but I'm trying to ammend the booking by one week to a date the same price as what i've paid and with a month's notice. I'm not even one of the thousands of business customers premier inn must get per week, I'm a single working mother who saved to treat her son to a one night short break. Now my money's gone and we've no chance of going. anyone want to buy room from me?! natalie.neill@btinternet.com.

Reviews.Title: “There are cheaper ways to stay in a tower block .. small and disappointing .. but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: CornishWebDesigner
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a Premier Inn in Druham I had high hopes. We stayed here for a Christmas break in 2009 and paid over £80/night. The first thing was that the Premier Inn was obviously in a converted tower block, that I'd guess at one stage was made up of council flats .. Only Fools and Horses style. The building had been convered .. which is fine .. but it still had traces of the old council flat fixtures and fittings, such as the windows. The room was of an OK standard, but it was much, much smaller than the previous room I had at a Premier Inn .. it was basically the bed + walking space with a tiny bathroom. The bathroom was done up wuite nice and the bed was fine .. but it was all a bit pokey. The windows were old glass and steamed up with the cold outside (it was duting the cold snap) .. the heating was hard to get to a decent temperature. Also, you needed a room key to use the lift, which was a problem when were checking out. The room was fine and acceptable .. but it was a disappointment after previous positive experiences with the company. I do kind of resent paying £165 to stay in a tower block .. but it was OKish. I'd stay there again, perhaps, but only for business, never pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: silwya99
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 2 nights, during weekend 23-25.1.2010, 8persons, staff perfect, very helpful, good breakfast we tried also cooked break. but continental b. is very good. I booked hotel and make all anout it, 3 rooms were big, clean and with perfect view, unfortunatelly our room was very very small :-(( but generally very good . hotel very close to underground. we have perfect price trought Dertour. so I would stay here again :-)

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel,great location,great service!”
Reviews.Author: kellybw
Reviews.Content: We were in London for a concert at the Hammersmith Odean and did some research on hotels near the location. They were all similar in price,especially on sat, even the budget hotels matched the so called better hotels so we booked the Premier. They kept us up to date by text even asking on the day if we wanted to book the evening meal. The hotel was right by Ravenscourt Underground station. The receptionist was very friendly and asked us is we had a preference for which floor we would like to stay on. We chose the 13!!! which in fact was the roof!! what a view. The rooms are on the smaller size but clean,tidy and even had a kettle/tea/coffee facility. We slept soundly, beds very comfy and no noise,even traffic. The breakfast was £7.75 for as much as you like,continental,cooked,pastries etc. Service was great. Really can't fault the hotel. Would Stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for Hammersmith events”
Reviews.Author: norfolknin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as travelled to London to see Billy Connolly at Hammersmith Apollo. We got off tube at Hammersmith station (then realised there was a nearer one!!) but it was a straight walk down to the hotel so no probs. On arrival the receptionist was very polite, asked us about our journey and checked us in promptly. We had a twin room on the 11th floor and although it was a bit cold, understandably at the moment, there was a fan heater supplied as well as wall heating. We had a small problem with the towels but after a call to reception the housekeeper came straightaway with more and she too was extremely polite. Really good nights sleep then down to a delicious cooked breakfast. Once again staff very polite and friendly. Check out prompt and once again, receptionist asked about our journey home and wished us a safe journey. All in all an enjoyable stay, will definitely stay here again, not only for Hammersmith events but when in London as the tube gets you wherever you want to be. On our last visit to London in November we stayed at the Kensington Hilton, paid nearly 3 times as much and got a much poorer service so I would wholeheartedly recommenmd this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great breakfast, 2 happy toddlers = 2 happy parents!”
Reviews.Author: HappyMumNeath
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night with husband, 4 year old and 2 year old. Very apprehensive as hadn't taken them to a hotel where we all stayed in the same room before. Very comfortable beds, good room size, larger than normal bathroom. Check in and out was simple, £12.00 charge for car park for 24 hours which meant we could go shopping in central London on the day we departed, leave the car and come back for it late afternoon. Breakfast was extremely good value and the children were offered Hot Chocolate even though it did not appear on the menu and the staff really looked after them. My husband and I had porridge which was superb, followed by English breakfast, orange juice, pomegranate juice and we could have had tea, coffee, etc. Tube station 3 mins walk from hotel. One stop to Hammersmith, walk across the platform and tube straight into central London, Knightsbridge, Piccadilly Circus, etc. Ideal with 2 young children and a pushchair. From hotel to Central London in 20 mins.# Will definitely stay again. Have previously stayed in 5 star Park Lane hotels but overall value for money would prefer Premier Inn Hammersmith.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: BebeZed
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Premier Inn Hammersmith was very pleasant. From the moment I checked in, the staff was very attentive. I was greeted warmly every time I entered the lobby, and if I needed anything, all I had to do was ask. The room was on the small side but very clean and comfortable. A table and chair was set up right in front of the window so I could work and gaze out the window. The bed was very comfortable and plenty of pillows were available. An electric kettle was provided, as were teabags, coffee, creamer, and sugar; the front desk will gladly supply more tea (etc) upon request but because I drink so much of it, I purchased my own tea and sugar. Wifi internet access is available but is not free; internet access is provided by a third party. I ended up spending £30 for the 9 days I was there. I did not see an option to be emailed a receipt, which I needed for tracking business expenses. The connection usually showed as 20% signal strength but was generally acceptable; I had very few drop-outs. I did dine in the hotel restaurant. I dined there for supper and had a very nice chicken curry; the wait staff was attentive and the food top-notch. I also had the "Premier breakfast" which was also very good. Location is very good - the Ravenscourt Park tube station is but a short walk and from there it's easy to get to anywhere you want to go. There is a small 24 hour grocer across the street -- they have the most wonderful falafel meal in the cold case that is a wonderful alternative to dining out. There is a pub next door, and two or three doors down there is a very nice Thai market with all sorts of wonderful fresh herbs, packaged seasonings, and noodle cups. There are many restaurants nearby, offering a variety of cuisines; there are also a few fast food places within walking distance. There is plenty of shopping nearby. Also, it's a short walk to the Thames, where you can take a stroll. Very nice! In short, the Premier Inn Hammersmith helped make my stay quite pleasant. I plan to return to London, and when I do I will once again stay at this hotel. I recommend it as a nice, comfortable, and reasonably priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: PaolaC_TO
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room, at he 8th flloor, with an L shape. Very good also for my child. Teh room was quiet, and with a great view on London. Staff was very kind and gently. A lot of restaurants and pub otuside, also a small supermarket open 24 hours/7 days. Tube station (Ravenscourt park) quite close.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone - especially if visiting the Apollo!”
Reviews.Author: skippyNorfolk
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for two nights while on a trip to a concert at Hammersmith Apollo. We didnt really know the exact location when booking online, just that it was nearby. Fortunately it turned out that the Underground station at Ravenscourt was a short walk from the Hotel and the Apollo was a ten minute walk down the road, so it was ideally located for us! The Staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were spotless and the beds comfy, there were two plump pillows each, a flat screen tv, hairdryer, tea, coffee, shampoo, handsoap, towels etc.. We didnt have the evening meal, though by the time we had finished shopping and dragged ourselves back to the hotel we wished we had! We did have breakfast, which was faultless, cooked breakfast was perfect, porridge was great - not like the dish of wallpaper paste I have been presented with on previous holidays! There was a smell in the bathroom, though the actual room was spotlessly clean, (there was a shower over a small bath, which I used and being 5'10" it was a bit of a squeeze, but I prefer a bath to a shower so I was happy with that!) must have been the drains, but I have mentioned this on my review to the Hotel so hopefully they will sort that out, but it wouldnt stop me from staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Premier Inn Hotel”
Reviews.Author: westlife07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Maybe because we arrived on a Sunday, the hotel car park was empty so plenty of spaces to choose from. Nice smooth check-in with Maria. Our room was on the 4th floor, compact but we were only sleeping in it, plenty of hanging space, nice soft towels and very clean. We booked the breakfast next morning, which was very nice, also it was cooked to order, so nice & hot. Whilst the kettle in the room was brand new, unfortunately it didn't work, a quick call to reception got it changed over, we requested some extra tea bags and sugar, we were given a bag with about a dozen each of tea-bags, coffees, milks and sugars in it. In the past we have stayed at the Holiday Inn Express, shan't in the future, Premier Inn is much cheaper and you get a decent breakfast not a "snack" as my husband calls it! Will definately be back on our next visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “Back again.....................”
Reviews.Author: EugeneMorice
Reviews.Content: Once again we are back at the Travel Inn in Hammersmith with our 2 children for what is rapidly becoming an annual sightseeing and shopping trip. This year the weather was a bit less hot and humid ( we hit the only 3 hot days of the year last year ) and so the temperature in the rooms was fine ( the aircon struggled a bit last year!!). The service in this Travel Inn was excellent. All the staff worked with a smile and the stay was excellent value ( lessons that need to be learned by other hotels in the Premier chain as we were to learn during our encounter with staff at one of Premier's Oxford lodges !!). The room was clean and a good size again and once again Christine ( and her colleague whose name I did not quite catch due to not being able to read the name on his badge due to my age and failing eyesight !!) really looked after us well in the restaurant. We have a son with special needs and all the staff were attentive to his needs no matter how demanding he became at times. Thanks everyone !! I have to say however that all the guests as far as we could see were treated with courtesy and consideration, so well done y'all !!!! Eugene Morice, Penzance Cornwall

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Could be better”
Reviews.Author: CJ_Dub
Reviews.Content: The staff, location and the prices are the positive points for staying in this hotel. The negative points are the rooms with the paper thin walls and the tiny lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for budget traveler!”
Reviews.Author: Sc0rpi0n65
Reviews.Content: The Premier Inn hotel at Hammersmith is a good budget hotel for any international traveler. Ideal location and well connected to the London city zones, it is one of the best hotel to spend the business trip stay or even if you are on vacation with family. The hotel has a small reception area with smiling & helpful staff. The rooms are very clean and well appointed. The rooms are secured and have all the necessary amenities a traveler would want. The house-keeping service ensures the rooms are kept clean & in order. The beds are large and very comfortable. The flooring has carpets, but it’s not smelly. There is a coffee machine in each room and the entire property is no smoking. The washroom is well designed and has a tub and powerful shower. Overall the room has everything one needs to make their stay comfortable and one cannot ask for more! The restaurant is small, but serves a great and wholesome breakfast. They feed & pamper you with hot and cold serves. One nice breakfast and it sets & starts your day perfectly with lots of energy and freshness!! The staff is very cordial and helpful and they ensure that your stay is full of comfort. I would recommend this hotel to all travelling to London and if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value bed for the night”
Reviews.Author: niall_mcdonald
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hammersmith Premier Inn on a Saturday night, while seeing a concert at the Albert Hall. Really pleased we chose this hotel. Excellent value for £81 (booked 2 days in advance). If you know Premier Inn you know what you're going to get and this hotel is no exception. Check-in was quick and efficient, and the bar/lobby area was smart and clean. Ask for a room on a high floor as the views are fantastic!! The rooms are well appointed but small - but then how much space do you need for 1 night? It was spotless and the bed was comfortable. Hotel felt safe with a secure access lift. Couple of small negatives: our shower head was loose, but useable; the aircon was only 'ok' and had to be left on all night. The hotel is less than 5 mins walk from the Ravenscourt Park tube station (District and Picadilly lines) which means you can be in the centre of London in around 30 mins. 1 stop from Hammersmith on the Hammersmith and City line puts this probably 10-15 mins from Paddington too. It's also in Zone 1-2 so you don't need to pay extra for a travelcard. Maybe a 10 minute walk down to the Thames and a few nice quiet pubs in the surrounding streets. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RooneyRooney
Reviews.Content: every staff of the hotel was fantastic ..the provided was better then any 5 star hotel...the service of the guys at the restaurant was mind blowing ....hats off to the indian guy whose name i dont remember but starts with letter 'ob' ....he was on his own with out any help ....but was cheerful enough to provide every guest with excellent standard of service and the breakfast chef who came out was very sweet

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again when in London”
Reviews.Author: smonkey5b
Reviews.Content: Rooms really clean although on the small side. Staff all very accommodating and with a smile too! One of our rooms lost all power and this was attended to within 5 minutes. There was one guest who was complaining that on returning to his room he had found a strange man asleep on the floor???

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay at Premier Travel Inn in Hammersmith”
Reviews.Author: Cowbridgelady
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hammersmith Premier Travel Inn for 2 nights as the location suited for a function we were attending. Usual travel inn experience - clean, comfortable and compact rooms with great views as we were on the 11th floor. Staff were all very helpful, Ravenscourt Park Tube Station (on the District Line) is about a 5 mins walk away and the area itself , predominantly Polish, felt safe with enough cafes, pubs and restaurants within walking distance. Dined out on our first night at a cheap and cheerful Italian about 5 mins walk down King Street to the right - Casa Mia (had seen a few good reviews for it on the net from locals so thought we'd give it a try). They did a £7.95 menu for a 2 course evening meal - had a huge prawn cocktail and a pasta course - good value by usual London prices. Breakfast in the Travel Inn (also £7.95) for the full English was ok. It is cooked to order, but disappointing that the baked beans were congealed on the plate as though they had been standing for ages and the tea was cold. So, on our 2nd day, decided to try somewhere else - crossed the road and walked down King Street to the right for 5/10 mins max and we found a Weatherspoons pub on a corner that do a cooked breakfast for £2.69 (or a gut buster cholesterol special - 2 of everything for £3.69). We had the £2.69 version and it was excellent - recommend it as long as you can stomach seeing people having a pint at 10.30 in the morning!!. Unfortunately, this stay, we had the car with us - the Travel Inn do have some spaces which are available on a first come, first served basis at £12 a day, but they were all taken by the time we arrived at 6pm so had to park in the NCP car park 5 mins walk away which charges £22.50 per day. Pleasant stay at the Travel Inn though and would stay there again if we needed to be in that part of London. My favourite PTI in London is County Hall - can't beat that one for location in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Converted office Block???”
Reviews.Author: proterra
Reviews.Content: Not uo to usual premier standards, We had booked a family room and my childs bed was practically a matress onb the floor not a proer bed as we have had elsewhere. The toilets made a horrendous noise when flushed so you could hear the ones around you in the night. Bathroom was quite large but they had stuck a poxy small bath in so you had to bend your knees when in it. Service in the restruant was very slow, 20 mins to take order then 30 after we got our food, Not very good food at that my wifes fishcakes werr greasy and the veg was cold. would not stay at this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: enones
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after an excellent experience with another Premier Inn at Earls Court. Less than 5 minutes walk from Ravenscourt Tube Station. The usual expectations from Premier Inn of clean bedroom and washroom prevail. Polite staffs. My photos attached are more of the surrounding areas of the hotel as the room conditions are pretty the same as with other Premier Inns. Located in an area where you can find various continental and Asian restaurants. Polish theatre, cafe, and Polish delicatessen just opposite the hotel. Nice neighbourhood and amenities. You can go to Ravenscourt Park and Thames Riverside Walk nearby for jogging. If you have the stamina, you can walk along the Thames River or King Street to Hammersmith.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: hyge
Reviews.Content: My wife, my 2 sons and myself really enjoyed our stay here and would use this Premier Travel Inn again. The staff were both polite and helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. We hit London on the hottest day of the year so the rooms were pretty hot and stuffy. The aircon did the best it could but by virtue of the fact that this Travel Inn is situated in a tall building the windows would only open so far, so sleeping was a bit difficult. The food in the small restaurant was traditional predictable Travel Inn fare ( lots of things are "off the menu on a Sunday evening sadly !), but this was actually an advantage to us since with 2 young sons a bit of predicatbility in terms of available food over a 3 night stay is quite useful ! In terms of location this Travel Inn is close enough to Central London so as not have to spend too long on the Tube (District Line from Ravenscourt Park) and far enough out to avoid the congestion charge ! Special mention must go to a young lady on the staff called Christine who works in the restaurant who was incredibly kind and patient with our youngest son Peter who has Prader Willi Synderome and can be a bit of a handful at times. Nice one !!! Eugene Morice Penzance Cornwall

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Chearful”
Reviews.Author: sb0b
Reviews.Content: chose this hotel as we were going to see High School Musical at the Apollo, lots of places to eat in the area and felt safe walking back to the hotel after the show. Stayed for 2 nights and the staff were very helpful and friendly any problems you had they would do their best to help. close to the tube station so handy for the rest of the sight seeing. Good views from the windows too.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Him-and-me
Reviews.Content: First time we've stayed at a Premier Inn and we're quite impressed. It had been recently refurbished so that was rather nice - could smell new carpet in the corridor! Room therefore very clean, and what you'd expect from a chain such as this. Does exactly what you'd expect! Pleasant staff when we checked in and when we bought coffee from the bar late at night. Would stay here again and would stay at other Premier Inns in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: MrsControlFreak
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights for a long weekend trip to London, 2 adults and 12 year old child. We would definitely go back. Tube staion very close (Ravenscourt park, less than 2 min walk). Clean modern rooms, excellent breakfast (free for 12 year old) with as much as you can eat. I liked the fact that the cooked breakfast was freshly prepared and not on the buffet. Staff very friendly. If I was trying to be picky I could find a few flaws, but as long as you're not expecting the Ritz it was great.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: eattravelandbe
Reviews.Content: On Arriving my initial thought was good location in the mid of Hammersmith near the Train station. The room were small but clean and had everything you needed I wouldnt like to stay in here for a week but 4 a couple of nights it was big enough. Had Breakfast in the morning which took over half an hour to come and when it did, it was good but I would recommend asking for double everything as the Beans and Mushrooms portions were very small. Overall it was an average hotel! nothing special

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: REC703
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on 1 January at 11:30 AM after an overnight fight. It was obvious that they had been full for New Year's even and quests were sleeping in. However, the very nice young lady at reception got housekeeping on the phone and had a room cleaned for us before we could finish our coffee. Location is great for exploring this part of London. Short walk to to Black Lion Lane and its three great London Pubs: The Black Lion on the Thames and the Cross Keys and Carpenters Arms. Each a good example of a 'locals' London pub. Also a short hike down Chiswich High Road to numerous good restaurants, shopping and watering holes. Room though not large was comfortable and a good value, especially for the location.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: rammell
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed at a Premier Inn (formerly known as Premier Travel Inn) before, you'll know what to expect. It is a no-frills hotel. The rooms are on the small size - particularly noticeable for our friend from the U.S. - and being in Central London the prices are a little higher than their other hotels around the country, typically £90 per night. However, as one correspondent has already put it, "it does what it says on the tin". My room was very clean and was well furnished. The service was excellent with all of the staff I came into contact with being extremely friendly and helpful. Surpisingly, the hotel was quieter than I expected. I usually take a pair of ear-plugs when I book into a London budget hotel but didn't need to use them on this occassion. My 11th-floor rooom had great views and the traffic noise was undetectable. The hotel is just 3 minutes walk from the closest Tube station (Ravenscourt Park) with trains into the city taking about 25 minutes. Premier Inn hotels do not usually have their own on-site restaurant so Hammersmith was an exception in this regard. However, I would not recommend it. The service was great and the prices were OK but the pizza that I had was about the worst pizza I've ever eaten..... very greasy and artificial-tasting. The guys on the table next to me did not seem too impressed with their food either. Loads of nearby places to eat in however so best eat out I think.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and GREAT air-conditioning, but the price?”
Reviews.Author: HacketteMcHack
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for a family party. It was a Saturday in July, and we paid £90 for a double en-suite, which we thought a little steep, especially seeing as my partner's parents were staying at the 4* Novotel down the road for the same price. However, the location (about 1 minute from the tube, close to bars, restaurants, shops and on a major, but quiet, road) made up for it as it's ideal for those driving (in London!?) or on public transport. The hotel itself was fine, pretty average really, apart from the beds, which truly were VERY comfortable (as the company promise). Check-in was a hassle-free affair, and the staff were very friendly indeed. They were happy to answer questions, and offer directions to the event we were heading to. Our room was a good size with an equally good sized bathroom, with pretty boring, but not unpleasant, views across the car park. Most importantly, the room had air-conditioning, which was much appreciated after a 1hour trip on the underground on a 30 degree centigrade day...Moreover this was GOOD air-con (and anyone who stays in hotels regularly will apreciate this I'm sure!). The bathroom was a bit basic, and took an AGE to get any hot water through the taps, despite turning my hand to all the tricks in the book to get them to run warm. But it had everything I needed; bath, shower, etc. Functional I believe is the word... The room and bathroom were both immaculately clean, but there was a slightly odd, almost damp smell in the room, which I see another reviewer has mentioned. It was innocuous, but not being able to open the window didn't help. It didn't bother me in the slightest but it was noticable when I walked in the door The room was quiet, as I say we stayed on a Saturday night in the school summer holidays and we didn't hear a thing, either from other rooms or from outside. Such a relief and a change from some other, more expensive hotels! Breakfasts were good, but quite expensive for what is on offer (as I often find). Guests would probably do better to head out to one fo the local delis or cafes (5-10 mins away) to pick up a bite, but what was on offer in the hotel was perfectly passable and the staff serving were very kind and helpful. All in all a very good, middle of the road London hotel. It's nothing special, but great if you need to head to West London for whatever reason, it's a safe bet. Would I stay here again? Sure, so long as the 4* wasn't cheaper again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Smokey02
Reviews.Content: Myself and my mother had a family room with a king size bed, a single bed and a mattress on the floor. Both beds were extremely comfortable. The room was spotless when we arrived and was maintained that way each day. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. 10 min slow walk to Hammersmith tube station. Downsides: Only had a small bath and the shower over the bath wasn't the best, the water tended to spray all over the place.

Reviews.Title: “Like a hall of residence”
Reviews.Author: steakandalepie
Reviews.Content: This no-frills, functional hotel resembles a university hall of residence, with endless corridors and swing doors to drag your bags through. Our room was basic and smelled a little odd but it just about sufficed for the few hours that we needed it before an early morning flight from Heathrow. We arrived at 1pm but were unable to access our room, so had to pile our bags into a storage cupboard and come back later. The location is good for Ravenscourt Park tube, but if you are considering this hotel because it is near to Heathrow, be warned that you will have to change trains to get on the Piccadilly line.

HotelInfo.Name: Premier Inn London Hammersmith
HotelInfo.Address: 255 King Street | Hammersmith, London W6 9LU, England
